attributes.descriptionHtml:
Age: 3 Years
Weight: 48 lbs
Location: RI
  
This dog has been spayed/neutered, is up to date on shots, on heartworm preventative and is microchipped.

Bella certainly lives up to her name...Bella is one BEAUTIFUL girl! We believe Bella is a Shepherd/Rottweiler mix around 3 years old and the perfect size and temperament for a family companion. She is sweet, friendly and sociable, and loves meeting new people and dogs. She seems to adapt to her surroundings very quickly. Bella is one happy girl,her tail never stops wagging and treats every day as if it's going to be a good one!  She is great with other dogs and easily engages in play with others.  There is one thing Bella does not like, though, and that is cats...no cats for Bella! She has not lived with children, but we have observed her around respectful youngsters and she is calm but interested; we think she would do well in a household with kids.  Bella is completely house trained, as she only had one accident. She is crate trained, but she will whimper for a few minutes then she gives up and goes to sleep. She walks very nicely on a leash, as she stays right by your side. She is eager to please, food motivated, and would love to learn some basic commands; she is already working on "sit" and "paw". She would also love to have someone to sit with and cuddle with, but she is also confident and has no issues being by herself. Bella loves to eat ice cubes and she is not food aggressive with humans but she isn't crazy about other dogs near her food dish, although she is okay with dogs near her water dish. The vacuum scare her and she will bark while it's on. She is playful, loves toys and loves to run, she will even play fetch sometimes. We would like her to have a home with a big fenced-in backyard, or have access to other safe ways of getting off-leash exercise.  She would love to take daily walks around her new neighborhood with her new pack.
 
Bella was a stray running in the streets when she was hit by a car. She was brought to the vet and was found to have a fracture to her pelvis and they also discovered she was heartworm positive. Bella was treated for heartworms and her hip was repaired. She is now healed,her hip doesn't slow her down at all. She is healthy and ready for a home of her own. If Bella sounds like the loving fur-ever friend you have been searching for, please fill out an application...you will be glad that you did!
 
Medical Note: Bella tested positive for heartworm disease in 2015. Bella was treated following the American Heartworm Association protocol without complications and is now cleared to travel. Treatment was completed in December 2015, and Bella tested negative for heartworms in March 2016. To learn more about heartworm disease, please visit: https://www.heartwormsociety.org/pet-owner-resources/heartworm-basics. Please discuss any concerns with your veterinarian.  
Medical Note: Bella's fracture of the pelvis was above the joint on the right side. Surgery was performed in 4/2015 and a stainless steel wire was used to stabilize the fracture in place. The fracture has since healed and the joints are in good alignment with no signs of any arthritis. Bella has maintained her weight at about 46-48 pounds and she loves to run and play. As of a recheck on 3/22/2016, there are no abnormalities noted with the joint. As with any orthopedic injury, arthritis or other complications may develop as the dog ages.

Adoption Fee: $370 
To apply for this dog, fill out an adoption application on our website:  www.sosarl.org/aa/

**Additional info you should know -  For most of our dogs, we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix.  We get to know each of our dogs as an individual and do our best to describe and place them based on personality not breed label.   Some dogs may not yet be in New England, nor ready for immediate adoption.  There may be additional vetting, quarantine, waiting periods and/or fees depending upon your state of residence. If you have questions or concerns on any of this, you can discuss this with your Adoption Counselor.

attributes.name: Save One Soul Animal Rescue League
attributes.about: SOSARL is dedicated to helping at risk animals as we work towards a No Kill Nation.  SOSARL facilitates the rescue and placement of homeless dogs with loving forever homes. We advocate for homeless and at risk animals while providing comfort, rehabilitation and veterinary care to the animals in our program. SOSARL endeavors to promote and support life-saving initiatives that enable responsible pet guardianship while treating each animal and adopter as an individual.
